sentence: If only I lived close by...
The Asian fusion feel spreads throughout the whole restaurant and you can see it in their food as well as their interior design.
We were one of only a few tables and felt like the pace was scattered.
Your basic hole-in-the-wall sushi joint in downtown.
The two rolls I had, while in theory should be different, tasted very very similar.
Wouldn't choose to go back unless I had to.

The food had intricate flavors, but after the appetizers (crudo and uchi salad), entrees (salmon and rabbit), fried milk dessert and ordering an extra roll -- we went home and ate a sandwich and some ramen.
We were still extremely hungry afterwards.
But, Uchiko is freaking expensive, for a college student, and we were still hungry afterwards.
Probably not returning for a while.
The Kung pao cauliflower was over battered, the steak in the steak and cheese spring rolls was overcooked, the pizza was very similar to DiGiornos.

sentence: Like overpriced BAD fusion- doesn't hit any of the marks.
Don't order food.
Drinks.
They service solid drinks and it's an okay bar at which to loiter.
They have a decent price for full pints- and they serve the full standard 20oz pint.
Yes, come to water the hole- nothing else.
I would have enjoyed having a bit more service in the dining room keeping it clean.
I think I might have to hike over to Piada right now.

Food was great - service not so much - waiter got our order wrong - dishes we served one at a time for the two of us and his corrected dish took way to long - the waiter walked away from us as we were asking a question - not interested.
We came here for brunch before we headed out to a Orlando City Soccer game and we didn't want to leave.
Can't wait to come back here !
It's hard not to order ribs but maybe for lunch?
The eggplant dish was very sweet and it looked like the left over for the night, curry shrimp was alright, not that bad but not that tasty either.
The toast tasted like grease used up 10x.
Not coming back.
The pork bun was so-so; the filling was tasty but mushy.
It had too much broth and the brisket was a bit overcooked.
If you want to come here, ask about their cleaning schedule first.
I visit Bonefish for three things...$5 Bang Bang Shrimp on Wednesdays, drink specials and atmosphere.
Okay I went back again.
This time I needed to try more sushi items so I started with the Godzilla Roll which was pretty good and the God of Fire Roll which was a sushi lovers dream!!
The sushi was pretty good, but the seaweed salad was bad.
I don't know if they are aware of this, but DONT get the seaweed salad.
I felt like it's kind of a mess to eat with the slaw at the bottom of the taco cone but the fried chicken and avocado was good.
He said the bread tasted old and the meat tasted like it'd been boiled.
At first I was disappointed when I was told the ham and swiss croissant was not available but it quickly turned around when she offered the turkey avocado sandwich.
I also tried the million dollar bar which DOES taste like a million bucks.
Everything is made in the mornings and can be modified to meet any dietary or specialty needs.
Classic dishes come with a take home dish when ordered.
For dinner, my husband had the spaghetti and meatball - obviously made with love.
Cheers Maggianos!
You rocked our V-Day!
For years this has been the go to place in Harvard Square for reasonable food, good micro-brew and pretty good service.
It isn't cheap, but the food is very consistent.
If you purposely create a line to draw hype then you're not the best.

We waited at least 20 minutes to order right when we were at the front of the line when half the restaurant was empty and the staff was just standing f around purposely waiting for the line to get longer.
Really just tasted like steamed seafood with seasoning poured over it.
Would have been a solid 5 star if seafood had a chance to marinate in seasonings.
I'd highly recommend to call ahead, we waited for about 40 minutes for our food, wasn't expecting that from a food truck.
Getting to the truck is a bit tricky, you'll think you've gone the wrong way but it's there and well worth it.
I would definitely return, but will call ahead
I guess I should go more often lol.
The tea menu is similar to standard boba places but they also serve Papa Hayden cakes and large decadent toasts for dessert.
If you are feeling something savory, they have a list of fried goodies, ranging from Taiwanese style popcorn chicken to fries.
It seems to always take forever to get food.
Unfortunately the food isn't quite as charming as the atmosphere.
And compare with the taste, it was really expensive.
Not creative, just basic good Italian classics and reasonable prices.
So, that's when Bertini's is the one to go to.
If you need a place to take the family, this is it--something for everyone.
My Diner has all the raw materials to be very good, I hope it will survive in its slightly awkward location - maybe some oak grove commuters will stop by.
They definitely need some sort of "come on in" from the street, it otherwise looks like another store on the strip.
Can't wait to come back and see how they're doing in the dirty rose.
The real star was the sides and the fried deviled egg appetizer.
We went most of our meal with no drink refills and eventually had to get up and ask for a refill.
If you're in Atlanta try it but you're not missing much if you dont.
I had wanted to come here for the oyster special for the longest time, and I finally got it.
Next time I wanna come on Monday for the seafood special.
My red snapper taco had 2 bones in it.
Won't return.
The Hungry Toad is a tradition for our friend.
She took down our orders with no problem and accommodated us with a pitcher of water on the hot day.
After our party of 4 were seated at 2 small tables, ever 5 min a waiter (5 waiters) and the owner (extremely rude) asked us to split our table.
It tastes just like a Thin Mint cookie!
I'm not a huge Red Robin fan, but will go for the hubby once in a while.
Crumbs on the table and chairs, sticky menus, filthy floors and even the touch screen table kiosk had food particles stuck to it.
Rich with flavor and spiced just right, it seems hard to go wrong with anything on the menu... For my first visit I tried to create a well-rounded experience, sharing a number of dishes with friends.

Included were the samosa chaat (fantastic), the spicy beef puffs (a light flaky perfect medium between southern-style biscuits and filo-dough filled with the perfect flavored curry gravy), the vada pav (toasted to crisp hawaiian rolls and a loaded potato patty), and the idly fry (crispy rice sticks reminiscent of carnival corn dogs meets indian french fries).
Get wild with the sauces and chutneys, dipping whatever you can get your hands on into whichever one!!
In just one trip my life has changed, and numerous Austin Indian food restaurants have been pushed aside.
A reason to go to Wonderland!
Sat down at the bar area (no wait) because a table would have been 45 minutes!
As soon as I cut into it, the tartar tower collapsed into the sauce.
Basically had to "fish" the rest of the Hamachi out of the sauce.
To boot the crispy onion flakes completely overpowered the entire dish.
Thank god I had an hour to kill to get into Raglan Road ;) the saving grace to Morimoto is that it is across the sidewalk from a quality Irish joint!
It's alright, I'm not in love with anything except their fried soft shell crab and unique dipping sauce.

The food here is excellent, great tastey tenderloin and the haddock was amazing...I found a piece of stray pasta in my caesar salad but what can u do, it happens, and i told the waiter/bus boy and they did nothing...the service here is the pits for the prices and great quality food they serve.
i think when they updated it from a holiday inn, they kept the same servers.
Go for the food, but be prepared to wait wait wait
Great Vibe would definitely go back.
It's all about the view but food is not too bad ..just a. Bit pricey Great option when you have a full family wanting to chillax and mingle at the top of tjeointain
I created a yelp account just for this review.... Angel our server didn't get our drinks for 20 minutes and we got water... it took 30 more minutes for bread and butter!
He brought us our food and never came back until food was done, well the food that was cooked fully the chicken my husband ordered wasn't fully cooked and we never got our refills!!!
We waited 15 minutes for our tickets that were wrong... I have had good service before but it seems like the standard of great customer service has been lowered
We felt as if our waiter took advantage of the mandatory 18% gratuity.
Our dining experience took 2.5 hours and our glasses were empty for over an hour.
Definitely hit the spot - my boyfriend ate 2 trays of chicken feet by himself haha.
Will be back!
Exactly what you expect from The Capital Grille.
Can't wait to go back.

The blue corn pancakes tasted burnt, the decaf coffee tasted "out of a packet" according to one of our friends, our other friend said the polenta was overly salty, and our mushroom omelette was missing mushrooms... but it did have lots of onions.
This is sad because the restaurant is beautiful, overlooking the river and very classy.
As nice as this place looks, it appears they are not hiring very inspired chefs - either that or Sunday was their day off.
So I don't know what is going on with this restaurant.
The food was okay for me but the people around me really seemed to enjoy their meal.
I used the $2 sport cup for free sandwich/chips coupon too and I was pretty happy with my meal.
Four stars because of price but my experience was 5 stars because of the coupon!
This place was average but being that it was in Disney springs property obviously very expensive.
The chicken fingers were literally shaped like a log of poo.
I would most likely opt to try other places then this one again.
It was $23 for a very generously-sized 6 inch cake (surprisingly tall) with fruit filling (strawberry & vanilla mousse).
Street parking only which may be difficult during busy times (I got lucky and scored a good spot).
You can choose your crust, pizza sauce and toppings.
There are wheat and gluten free options in crust.
For topping you can go crazy and select as many as you want for a fixed price.
I have sometimes faced a little reluctance from staff when a customer goes crazy for toppings, however this time my staff was amazing.
She took all the request with a smile and did not make me feel too conscious about my choices.
I had hot roast beef sandwich with fries and I guarantee you I will be back!!!

Slow slow kitchen and mediocre at best, nothing special at all!

He gave me this huge soup looking cup when I just wanted a side I asked for a smaller one he said that was the only one but my salsa was in a smaller container so that didn't make sense turned a $20 meal into $30 .
Also charged me $2 for pico I asked for it to just be in the quesadilla but they said they couldn't do that so that was an inconvenience.

I figure the tacos deserve -43 stars, but the lady running the drive-thru was super sweet and deserved 45 stars.

sentence: I have been running into a lot of brand spanking new places lately, and this one I can add to the list.
All meat and seafood dishes are really good except for shrimp dishes which can be improved further

I will definitely be back to try more things!
Food was good but a little on the pricey side for us.
I would have given only two stars, but the food was very good - seasoned well and very flavorful.
The shrimp tempura had too much batter, while I would have liked more eel in my roll.
She never came around to refill drinks.
The second food was served she pushed us out asking to box things up while we were still eating.
Some here say it's pricey but only if you're a McD's regular (ugh).
I had the Colorado Jack Scramble and the eggs were perfect and the Jack Cheese melted on top added a little kick, the bacon was flavorful and crisp, the english muffin was just Ok.
I believe that they first par-boil the potatoes, so they can quickly brown them in a skillet, and are adding too much salt to the water.
It may be daunting navigating the menu at first since there is so much but you can never go wrong with ordering any clay pot.
The taste was fine, it was the texture of the noodles that was off.

One time, when my dad and I were taking what I guess the girls behind the counter thought was too much time to decide what we wanted, they made exasperated gestures; even though they were talking in Chinese, which I can't understand, it was pretty clear they were making fun of us (by the way, we were the only ones in the shop).
Can't wait to go back again!

I ordered a fever tree ginger beer, not super happy with the 7$ it cost me considering a 4 pack at any grocery store costs 6.99$. I also ordered the pepperoni pizza which has a ridiculous amount of sesame seeds on the crust.
I probably wouldn't come back here unless it's for someone's birthday or something.

The waitress was very attentive and really gave us some good suggestions.... We really liked her... The place was a little cluttered as far as decor (I like a cleaner appearance when I'm in a place for the first time), but overall it was okay.

The outdoor seating was a nice touch for those of us that smoke, but also caused some issues with blinding me when they went in and out (I know where not to sit next time I go.... & I will be back)....
